meanings.definition: Misfocuses (verb): to focus incorrectly or inaccurately.
meanings.sent1: She misfocuses on the wrong details when studying for exams.
meanings.sent2: He often misfocuses on unimportant tasks instead of the main goal.
meanings.sent3: The detective misfocuses on the red herring, leading him away from the real suspect.
meanings.sent4: Her mind misfocuses like a camera lens, blurring the important points.
meanings.sent5: Misfocusing during a presentation can make the audience lose interest quickly.

meanings.definition: Misfocuses (noun): plural form of misfocus, referring to instances of incorrect or inaccurate focusing.
meanings.sent1: The misfocuses in his photographs were due to poor lighting.
meanings.sent2: The misfocuses in the report made it difficult to understand the main points.
meanings.sent3: The misfocuses in the movie added a comedic element to the serious scene.
meanings.sent4: The misfocuses in her painting represented the chaos in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The misfocuses in the telescope caused the stars to appear blurry.
